text: What is the determinant of a 2x2 matrix with elements a, b, c, and d?
What is the identity matrix for a 2x2 matrix?
What is the rank of a matrix?
answer: The number of non-zero rows in its row echelon form
a: The number of non-zero rows in its row echelon form
b: The number of columns in the matrix
c: The number of rows in the matrix

answer: A set of vectors that is closed under vector addition and scalar multiplication
a: A set of vectors that is closed under vector addition and scalar multiplication
b: A set of vectors that is closed under matrix multiplication
c: A set of vectors that is closed under vector subtraction
d: A set of vectors that is closed under dot product

text: What is the transpose of a matrix?
answer: A new matrix obtained by swapping rows and columns
a: A new matrix obtained by swapping rows and columns
b: A new matrix obtained by multiplying each element by -1
c: A new matrix obtained by adding a constant to each element
d: A new matrix obtained by reversing the order of elements

text: What is an eigenvalue of a matrix?
answer: A scalar such that there exists a non-zero vector for which the matrix times the vector equals the scalar times the vector
a: A scalar such that there exists a non-zero vector for which the matrix times the vector equals the scalar times the vector
b: A scalar such that the matrix times the scalar equals zero
c: A scalar such that the matrix times the scalar equals the identity matrix
d: A scalar such that the matrix times the scalar equals the transpose of the matrix

text: What is the trace of a square matrix?
answer: The sum of the elements on the main diagonal
a: The sum of the elements on the main diagonal
b: The product of the elements on the main diagonal
c: The sum of all elements in the matrix

text: What is a basis of a vector space?
answer: A set of linearly independent vectors that span the vector space
a: A set of linearly independent vectors that span the vector space
b: A set of vectors that are all orthogonal to each other
c: A set of vectors that are all parallel to each other
d: A set of vectors that are all equal in magnitude

text: What is the null space of a matrix?
answer: The set of all vectors that, when multiplied by the matrix, result in the zero vector
a: The set of all vectors that, when multiplied by the matrix, result in the zero vector
b: The set of all vectors that, when multiplied by the matrix, result in the identity matrix
c: The set of all vectors that, when multiplied by the matrix, result in the transpose of the matrix
d: The set of all vectors that, when multiplied by the matrix, result in the determinant of the matrix

text: What is the inverse of a matrix?
answer: A matrix that, when multiplied by the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
a: A matrix that, when multiplied by the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
b: A matrix that, when multiplied by the original matrix, results in the zero matrix
c: A matrix that, when multiplied by the original matrix, results in the transpose of the original matrix
d: A matrix that, when multiplied by the original matrix, results in the determinant of the original matrix
